4. Mr Eric Schmidt will become executive chairman of the company, focusing externally on partnerships and government outreach. Moments after Google announced the change, Mr Eric Schmidt sent a message to his Twitter followers saying, Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! Mr Eric Schmidt has been Google's chief executive since July 2001, when he took over the role from Mr Larry Page . Mr Larry Page said Eric Schmidt had done "an outstanding job leading Google for the last decade

The executive change is very much unexpected, and somewhat of a concern to investors, said Clayton Moran, an analyst at Benchmark Co.. more mature leader. Eric Schmidt , 55, will remain an adviser to Larry Page and Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , as Google's executive chairman. The changes will be effective April 4. In my clear opinion, Larry Page is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come, Eric Schmidt said. Larry Page praised Eric Schmidt , too.
